"Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is all right, isn't it? OLIVIER looks out from behind the camera, patient and charming.  "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is all right, isn't it?"     "Well, we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is... all right, isn't it?"  Can't we just drop it?  Oh, sure. (Pause, she looks stricken) Paula!  I don't get it. He's such a strange man. I think she'd figure out he only invited her to sleep with her.        I can't do this. I can't.     "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we? Gee, this is all right, isn't it?"  "Well we're still the first ones, aren't we?  Gee, this is all right too, isn't it?" There is a stunned moment. WATTIS gapes and MARILYN looks around uncertainly. Did she say it? OLIVIER gestures frantically from behind the camera that she should carry on. She hesitates... ... there is an agonising beat... ... and then she panics and bolts for the side of the set.  Paula!  I don't know who Elsie is. I can't act her if I don't know who she is!     I can't find her. She's not there.  She's not real.  Are you saying I don't need to act?     I want Lee.                             How old are you?  You remind us of the young king in the movie. Kind of honest and innocent.  What's your job on this picture?     You're Larry's assistant too.  What were you doing in my house last night? Did he send you?     Are you spying on me?  Colin? Whose side are you on? COLIN stares at her. She looks utterly beautiful and vulnerable in the shadowy light. There is only one answer anyone could give.  Call me Marilyn. He is suddenly overwhelmed by a rush of sympathy. She looks so lost and vulnerable. Perhaps he means it. Perhaps he is on her side now.                 Oh, but everyone says you were a wonderful Elsie on stage.                          Here, let me. She pours some brandy into a glass and gives it to him.  Are you frightened of me, Colin?     Good. Because I like you.  I want you to help me. Will you do that?  But you know what's going on. You can see both sides of the situation.  I want you to be honest. Tell me everything.  Relax. I thought you weren't scared of me.  Are you hungry? I'll have them send in a tray. I'm starved.  Oh, gee, I'm sorry. Am I interrupting something? Maybe you have a Mrs. Colin waiting for you at home?  So we can talk as long as we like?  Why is Sir Olivier so mean? He talks to me as if he's slumming.     Are you sure you can handle that? You don't look old enough to drink.  It's Marilyn.  I'm 30. I guess that makes me an old lady to you.  Do you know I've been married three times already? How did that happen?  They always look right at the start.        Let's walk in the garden. See if we can find any more reporters in the bushes. She giggles. COLIN's heart contracts as she casually takes his arm.  I didn't know it was so pretty out here.  I am the sights. She giggles again, her mood lighter.  Look at us. We're just like Elsie and the young King. What would Sir Laurence say if he could see us now?     I wanted to be an artist. To grow as an actor. I was so proud to be working with the great Olivier.  Now he thinks I'm the enemy. She looks at him innocently. COLIN hesitates.  Every time I walk into the studio I feel this sense of doom come over me. He looks at me like he's smelling a pile of rotten fish. And the crew hate me. Paula is the only person I can trust.  Except for you now, maybe. She looks at him, her eyes huge. COLIN feels his senses swim as he stares into them... ... and then ROGER suddenly appears on the steps.  Goodbye, Colin. Thanks for telling me the truth. COLIN stares after her. It is a second before he realises that ROGER is gazing at him sternly.                 Hi, Colin. COLIN smiles, self-conscious. MARILYN stops and frowns, looking at Lucy.  Hey, are you guys dating? That's what I heard. She looks at him expectantly and suddenly his growing fantasy that she might actually be interested in him kicks in hard. He shrugs casually.     Too bad. You look cute together. She walks off with her retinue. There is a long pause. COLIN looks up to see LUCY staring at him in dismay. There are sudden tears in her eyes, which she wipes away angrily.       Roger and I decided to take you out for an adventure. Didn't we Roger?     No one can sack you, Colin. Except me, of course. She pats the seat next to her.  I don't like being on my own in the back. Before COLIN can respond he sees the curious MILTON running back, having spotted MARILYN in the back.  Do you think he saw me? COLIN can't help laughing. He finally tumbles into the back seat with MARILYN as the car speeds away. She scoots up to make room for him.  Snuggle up. This is fun. She threads her arm through his. He gazes down at their hands meshed together. ROGER's disapproval registers in the faintest flicker of his eyes. In the background the defeated and frustrated MILTON watches the car speed away.     This is how I ought to feel every day. COLIN smiles. Impulsively MARILYN hugs him.  Let's run away together. He turns ashen.     Only one day?  Or a week? He grins. She takes his hand, walking contentedly at his side.  What shall we do?     We met at a movie premiere. She said my dress was pretty.     Gee, I'd love to read all these books some time.     She's beautiful.  I hope I look that good when I'm 400.  I've heard of him! Didn't he paint that lady with the funny smile?  Do you have that one here too?  Really?     Look, Colin. COLIN kneels at her side.  I sure never had a dolls' house like this when I was a kid. She sees a perfect doll family inside, husband, wife and two children. She points at them, her eyes shining.  This is me, that's you, and these are our kids. She smiles wistfully and puts her hand on his arm.  Our daughter's so pretty. All little girls should be told how pretty they are. They should grow up knowing how much their mother loves them. Her eyes fill with sadness for a moment.  We look like such a happy family, don't we?     Shall I be "her"? She jumps up onto a step and strikes a pose - hip out, shoulders back, bosom thrust forward, the classic Marilyn "look". The delighted crowd bursts into cheers. COLIN stands proudly nearby, content to watch Marilyn being a star, basking in the certain knowledge that she will be leaving with him. One of the spectators turns to him.  This isn't a school, it's a palace! COLIN smiles.     It's like walking through history.     Whipped?  I'd never send my kids away. How long were you here?  Why?  It seems to me that you've had most things pretty easy.  So how are you going to do it?  Sounds pretty good to me.     Work hard, boys! I don't want anyone whipping you! A gawky young teenager near the front shouts out cheekily.  Hurry up, slow poke.     Oh my gosh! It's freezing!  This is great.  Don't worry. Roger will fix it. Oh, darn it... She holds her head and he looks at her with concern.  I have something in my eye. He swims across to her, very aware of her naked body under the water. She holds her head up to him.  Get closer. She tips her head back. He looks deep into her eyes - and suddenly she grabs him and kisses him on the lips. Before he can respond she laughs playfully and swims away.  That's the first time I've kissed anyone younger than me. There's a lot of older guys in Hollywood. She swims happily, totally relaxed. COLIN is much more self- conscious, keeping one nervous eye open for pleasure boats. Finally she swims back into the shallows and wades to the shore. She glances back, catching Colin looking. He glances away, embarrassed.     Don't be shy, Colin. It's nothing you haven't seen before.  Oh, Colin! And you an old Etonian!  Don't spoil it.  I want this to be the perfect date.  I haven't had a real date since I was 13 years old.  That was nice. I don't get kissed much.     Okay, what do we do now? COLIN looks at her, knowing it is time to return to the real world but reluctant to face it. There is a discreet cough and ROGER appears.  Hi Milton. She smiles sweetly.  Next time I come on set, you better make sure Colin is there. He looks at her in shock then bitterly at COLIN.                          Oh hi, Colin.  Phooey. She pats the sheets at her side and settles down sleepily on the pillow.  Get in. She is instantly back asleep. COLIN fumbles his way to the door. He searches for the key on the side table and quickly finds it. He goes to unlock the door, but then pauses, looking back at Marilyn. He puts the key back and bends down to whisper at the keyhole.     Colin? What are you doing here? MARILYN sits up, the sheet clutched to her chest, her expression panicky and disoriented. COLIN hurls himself off the bed.     The window? Is there a balcony, like in Romeo And Juliet? How romantic.  But I'm not sick. What makes them think that?  My mom.  They took her to the Sanatorium when I was a kid. I grew up in other people's homes, mostly.  I don't know who my father is so it might as well be him. Why not? I can pick any father I want.  Do you have a home, Colin? A real one?     And a mother and father who still live together?  And do they love you?  You're lucky.  Do you love me, Colin?  I'm not Greek.  I don't want to be a Goddess. I just want to be loved like an ordinary girl.  I found his notebook. It said I'd let him down.     He wanted me to find it. It said he should never have married me. That I was unpredictable and a woman-child, flighty and self- centred. He's left me, Colin. Why do the people I love always leave me?  All people ever see is Marilyn Monroe. As soon as they realise I'm not her, they run.  Boy, there's a lot of men in this business. And they all think you've got to sleep with them.  You're not like that. That's why I like you.  You should date that Wardrobe lady. She's pretty.     What's the matter? Don't you want to make love?  Okay. Friends.  This is nice. Like spoons. I used to do this with Johnny.  Johnny Hyde. My agent, back in the old days. He was thin, like you...           "I found a dream and lay in your arms the whole night through... I'm yours no matter what others may say or do... She has never sounded so happy or carefree. COLIN smiles.     "What?  Oh, go away, you silly man."  "Well, it's her own fault. She has no right being out at this time of night. She's 93!" MARILYN is utterly adorable. The crew, COLIN, amongst them, can't take their eyes off her. OLIVIER glances at ORTON behind the camera. They have a good take and they know it.        You think I can act, don't you, Colin?  I want him to stay with me.     I'm so tired of feeling scared. Life is so shitty. I hate it. It hurts too much.  Good old Colin. Looking after me, looking after Larry, looking after Vivien. Always putting everyone before yourself.        It hurts! It hurts, Colin! She is doubled up, clutching her stomach, sweating and frightened. COLIN sees a dark red stain on the sheets.  The baby. I can't lose the baby. COLIN looks at her aghast.  It's a surprise. For Arthur. Don't tell anyone. Promise me. He hurls himself off the bed and runs to the door.                 We have to say goodbye now, Colin. Arthur's on his way back. When this film is over I'm going to settle down and be a good wife to him. I'm going to learn to make Matzo ball soup as good as his dad's. She smiles wistfully at the fantasy.  We have to forget this ever happened.     What do you want to do? Marry me?  This is what I've worked for my whole life. I couldn't just give it all up.  You think I'm crazy?  I am happy. I got everything I ever dreamed about.     Well, maybe just a wink. Once in a while. He smiles, looks at her just once more, and then goes out. As the door closes we see Marilyn's smile fade to be replaced by a bleak, frightened expression.    I hope you will all forgive me. It wasn't altogether my fault. I have been ill.  I'd like you to remember I tried.     "..I found a dream and lay in your arms the whole night through, I'm yours no matter what others may say or do. Be light of heart and fancy free, that's the way to start, there will be nothing to lose till you lose your heart.." She sings with touching delicacy, nailing it perfectly. There is pin drop silence on the set as the crew watch. COLIN is amongst them. It is a moment of almost unbearable poignancy for him. He suddenly realises that SYBIL THORNDIKE has crept up silently behind him to watch the scene. As he turns to her she smiles with infinite wisdom and compassion, murmuring softly so that only he can hear.     "I've got a solemn word of warning for you."  "You know what's going to happen? I'm going to fall in love with you, because I always, always do." CLOSE on MARILYN as she smiles, her face radiating joy and vitality. And then, in the split second before ORTON calls `cut', MARILYN turns her head just a fraction and winks at Colin. He grins. OLIVIER looks up from the sofa, notices and smiles indulgently.                Buy a girl a drink? COLIN doesn't turn. He recognizes the voice and smiles.  I didn't want to leave without saying goodbye.     The first time you saw this, all I had on was the radio. Colin opens the package. It's her copy of the script. On the first page she has written a message scrawled in ink: TO THE  Don't forget me.  Everyone else on the picture wishes they could.  Be a gentleman and walk me to my car? The ever faithful Roger stands by the idling car. COLIN opens the car door for MARILYN. MARILYN beckons him closer. She kisses him gently. He smiles and says lightly:  That's for being on my side; and remember, when you see me wink, that's for you. ROGER walks around the car and looks over at COLIN.

description: Sir Laurence Olivier (Sir Kenneth Branagh) is making a movie in London. Young Colin Clark (Eddie Redmayne), an eager film student, wants to be involved and he navigates himself a job on the set. When movie star Marilyn Monroe (Michelle Williams) arrives for the start of shooting, all of London is excited to see the blonde bombshell, while Olivier is struggling to meet her many demands and acting ineptness, and Colin is intrigued by her. Colin's intrigue is met when Marilyn invites him into her inner world where she struggles with her fame, her beauty, and her desire to be a great actress.â€”napierslogs
